title: Coffeepot
medium: porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration and silver gilt
provenance_text:
Ailsa Mellon Bruce

This coffeepot was once part of a service commissioned around 1755 by a member of the English Ramsay family. The coat of arms was granted to John Ramsey of Southwark in London in 1669. The head of the Ramsay family is the Earl of Dalhousie. It is not known which member of the family ordered the Chinese export porcelain service. [see David Sanctuary Howard, "Chinese Armorial Porcelain" p.  484.
